topic.title: Naturally Sharp
topic.shortdesc: A semesterly show by one of Virginia Tech's all-male a capella groups, usually held in Haymarket Theatre.

body.p: Another favorite semesterly activity is the Naturally Sharp concert, held towards the end of each semester, usually in Haymarket Theatre. Each show has a theme, played out through goofy videos at the opening of each act, and complimented by costumes and marketing that fit the theme. Recent themes have included Batman, Total Drama Island, Avatar: The Last Airbender, and a 1920s murder mystery.

body.p: The guys of Naturally Sharp, or Natty, rehearse several times a week each semester to prepare a selection of a capella songs, carefully chosen to show off their voices and coordinate with the show's theme. As part of auditions, the group selects certain members as soloists, giving them a chance to show off their voices individually.

fig.title: Photo from "Total Natty Island," taken by Evvy Fite

image.alt: A photo from the audience of Naturally Sharp's performance titled "Total Natty Island."

body.p: Natty shows are fun and vibrant, and they consistently sell out Haymarket Theatre. Tickets are $7 in advance and $10 at the door. They always have a loud contingent of alumni in attendance, ready to hop up onstage for the alumni song at the end of the night.

Though the music is fantastic and the energy high, it is worth mentioning that Naturally Sharp shows can be a bit of an overwhelming sensory experience, which should be taken into consideration before attending. Additionally, they stop between songs for speeches and raffles, which can be annoying to some people.

Despite this, however, each Naturally Sharp concert is a fantastic experience, and a great way to relax for an evening. Current students and alums alike can have a fantastic time and leave with music in their ears.
